result.execSummary:
The defendant Alisha M Danning was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alisha M Danning is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alisha M Danning was found guilty of Credit Card-Theft by Acquisition [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(3)(a).
  • Alisha M Danning was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions if revoked.  Sentence credit for 2 days were granted.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $41.00 to be paid to Mitchells Tavern.  Bail applied to restitution.  Paid in full.
Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.

No contact with B.H..
Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Anger management counseling to be determined by Agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Defendant Alisha M Danning in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Steinle makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count 2
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
75 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 2 days).  Concurrent.  
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with B.H.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
Anger management counseling to be determined by Agent.  
Condition Time: 5 days Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS consecutive- STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
COSTS:  $253.00 bail to be applied 
Restitution:  41.00 to be paid to Mitchells tavern, bail to be applied.

Defendant Alisha M Danning in court with attorney Michael J Steinle. David Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed.  Defendant pleads guilty to counts #2 and 3.
